result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan M. Poblitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-376, 226, 174 and 409.

2:56 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to 15CM-174 Count 1.
15CM-174 dismiss and read in Count 2.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 15CM-226.
15CM-376 will be dismissed and read in.
15CM-409 will be also dismissed and read in.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Halverson concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 15CM-174 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CM-226 Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-174: Count 1: Disorderly Conduct, domestic incident, as a repeater
15CM-174: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-226: Count 1: Receiving Stolen Property, as a repeater
15CM-376: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-409: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-174:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve second half on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies for the program after an assessment is done
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Court is not ordering DNA Sample
Perform 35 Hours of Community Service, preferrably with Portage County Parks Department
No contact with M.H. except to write a letter of apology to the victim, to be submitted to the agent to forward
Maintain full time employment
Comply with counseling/assessments as recommended by the agent
Restitution is open for 30 days, to be paid joint and severally with Ms. Lee and Ms. Firkus

15CM-226:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to 15CM-174
Jail credit for 5 Days
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sherif will allow
May serve second half on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies for the program after an assessment is done
Probation for a period of 18 Months, Concurrent to 15CM-174
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CM-174
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Comply with all conditions in 15CM174.
The signed bond is to be filed with the Clerk of Courts by 9/14/2015.

Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
